methods.name: account_channels
methods.description: The account_channels method returns information about an account's Payment Channels. This includes only channels where the specified account is the channel's source, not the destination. (A channel's "source" and "owner" are the same.) All information retrieved is relative to a particular version of the ledger.

fields.name: account
fields.description: The unique identifier of an account, typically the account's Address. The request returns channels where this account is the channel's owner/source.

fields.name: destination_account
fields.description: The unique identifier of an account, typically the account's Address. If provided, filter results to payment channels whose destination is this account.

fields.name: ledger_hash
fields.description: A 20-byte hex string for the ledger version to use.

fields.name: ledger_index
fields.description: The sequence number of the ledger to use, or a shortcut string to choose a ledger automatically.

fields.name: limit
fields.description: Limit the number of transactions to retrieve. The server is not required to honor this value. Must be within the inclusive range 10 to 400. Defaults to 200.

fields.name: marker
fields.description: Value from a previous paginated response. Resume retrieving data where that response left off.

methods.name: noripple_check
methods.description: The noripple_check command provides a quick way to check the status of the DefaultRipple field for an account and the NoRipple flag of its trust lines, compared with the recommended settings.

fields.name: account
fields.description: A unique identifier for the account, most commonly the account's address.

fields.name: role
fields.description: Whether the address refers to a gateway or user. Recommendations depend on the role of the account. Issuers must have DefaultRipple enabled and must disable NoRipple on all trust lines. Users should have DefaultRipple disabled, and should enable NoRipple on all trust lines.

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: If true, include an array of suggested transactions, as JSON objects, that you can sign and submit to fix the problems. Defaults to false.

fields.name: ledger_hash
fields.description: A 20-byte hex string for the ledger version to use.

fields.name: ledger_index
fields.description: The sequence number of the ledger to use, or a shortcut string to choose a ledger automatically.

methods.name: ledger
methods.description: Retrieve information about the public ledger.

fields.name: ledger_hash
fields.description: A 20-byte hex string for the ledger version to use.

fields.name: ledger_index
fields.description: The sequence number of the ledger to use, or a shortcut string to choose a ledger automatically.

fields.name: full
fields.description: Admin required If true, return full information on the entire ledger. Ignored if you did not specify a ledger version. Defaults to false. (Equivalent to enabling transactions, accounts, and expand.) Caution: This is a very large amount of data -- on the order of several hundred megabytes!

fields.name: accounts
fields.description: Admin required. If true, return information on accounts in the ledger. Ignored if you did not specify a ledger version. Defaults to false. Caution: This returns a very large amount of data!

fields.name: transactions
fields.description: If true, return information on transactions in the specified ledger version. Defaults to false. Ignored if you did not specify a ledger version.

fields.name: expand
fields.description: Provide full JSON-formatted information for transaction/account information instead of only hashes. Defaults to false. Ignored unless you request transactions, accounts, or both.

fields.name: owner_funds
fields.description: If true, include owner_funds field in the metadata of OfferCreate transactions in the response. Defaults to false. Ignored unless transactions are included and expand is true.

fields.name: binary
fields.description: If true, and transactions and expand are both also true, return transaction information in binary format (hexadecimal string) instead of JSON format.

fields.name: queue
fields.description: If true, and the command is requesting the current ledger, includes an array of queued transactions in the results.

methods.name: ledger_closed
methods.description: The ledger_closed method returns the unique identifiers of the most recently closed ledger. (This ledger is not necessarily validated and immutable yet.)

fields.name: ledger_hash
fields.description: A 20-byte hex string for the ledger version to use.

fields.name: ledger_index
fields.description: The sequence number of the ledger to use, or a shortcut string to choose a ledger automatically.

methods.name: ledger_current
methods.description: The ledger_current method returns the unique identifiers of the current in-progress ledger. This command is mostly useful for testing, because the ledger returned is still in flux.

methods.name: ledger_data
methods.description: The ledger_data method retrieves contents of the specified ledger. You can iterate through several calls to retrieve the entire contents of a single ledger version.

fields.name: id
fields.description: (WebSocket only) Any identifier to separate this request from others in case the responses are delayed or out of order.

fields.name: ledger_hash
fields.description: A 20-byte hex string for the ledger version to use.

fields.name: ledger_index
fields.description: The sequence number of the ledger to use, or a shortcut string to choose a ledger automatically.

fields.name: binary
fields.description: If set to true, return ledger objects as hashed hex strings instead of JSON. Defaults to False.

fields.name: limit
fields.json_type: Limit the number of transactions to retrieve. The server is not required to honor this value. Must be within the inclusive range 10 to 400.

methods.name: ledger_entry
methods.description: The ledger_entry method returns a single ledger object from the XRP Ledger in its raw format. See ledger format for information on the different types of objects you can retrieve.

fields.name: index
fields.description: Specify the object ID of a single object to retrieve from the ledger.

fields.name: account_root
fields.description: Specify an AccountRoot object to retrieve.

fields.name: check
fields.description: Specify the object ID of a Check object to retrieve.

fields.name: directory
fields.description: Specify a DirectoryNode to retrieve. If a string, must be the object ID of the directory, as hexadecimal. If an object, requires either dir_root or owner as a sub-field, plus optionally a sub_index sub-field.

fields.name: directory.sub_index
fields.description: If provided, jumps to a later "page" of the DirectoryNode.

fields.name: directory.dir_root
fields.description: (Required if directory is specified as an object and directory.owner is not provided) Unique index identifying the directory to retrieve, as a hex string.

fields.name: directory.owner
fields.description: (Required if directory is specified as an object and directory.dir_root is not provided) Unique address of the account associated with this directory.

fields.name: escrow
fields.description: (Optional) Specify an Escrow object to retrieve. If a string, must be the object ID of the Escrow, as hexadecimal. If an object, requires owner and seq sub-fields.

fields.name: escrow.owner
fields.description: (Required if escrow is specified as an object) The owner (sender) of the Escrow object.

fields.name: escrow.seq
fields.description: (Required if escrow is specified as an object) The sequence number of the transaction that created the Escrow object.

fields.name: offer
fields.description: Specify an Offer object to retrieve. If a string, interpret as the unique index to the Offer. If an object, requires the sub-fields account and seq to uniquely identify the offer.

fields.name: offer.account
fields.description: (Required if offer specified) The account that placed the offer.

fields.name: offer.seq
fields.description: (Required if offer specified) The sequence number of the transaction that created the Offer object.

fields.name: payment_channel
fields.description: Specify the object ID of a PayChannel object to retrieve.

fields.name: ripple_state
fields.description: Object specifying the RippleState (trust line) object to retrieve. The accounts and currency sub-fields are required to uniquely specify the RippleState entry to retrieve.

fields.name: ripple_state.accounts
fields.description: (Required if ripple_state specified) 2-length array of account Addresses, defining the two accounts linked by this RippleState object.

fields.name: ripple_state.currency
fields.description: (Required if ripple_state specified) Currency Code of the RippleState object to retrieve.

fields.name: binary
fields.description: If true, return the requested ledger object's contents as a hex string. Otherwise, return data in JSON format. The default is true if searching by index and false otherwise.

fields.name: ledger_hash
fields.description: A 20-byte hex string for the ledger version to use.

fields.name: ledger_index
fields.description: The sequence number of the ledger to use, or a shortcut string to choose a ledger automatically.
